reviews.review_msg: Terrible at explaining what he is doing. Inputs all his equations into a calculator that he has on his computer and expects the class to understand, while we aren't even allowed to use calculators during quizzes. Rushes past every topic and doesn't even explain any of them well. Expects people to know what he's talking about, nobody does...
just please save yourself, and don't take this course with him.

This prof is extremely rood and just plain apathetic. I don't need him to hold my hand, but if you want to talk about my status in the class at least have the decency to pull me to the side. He lacks manners. He told me I was failing in front of the whole algebra workshop.

I've had Dr. Knox for two semesters in a row. The hate on here comes from the difficulty of the course rather than his teaching approach. Math is hard, you need to study a lot. Knox is clearly hardworking and beyond skilled at math. The biggest problem is that there's very little work you get feedback on, and the explanations are general.

Extremely passionate. Wonderful professor I wish there were duplicates of this guy teaching all the math courses. Those who didn't do well are the ones who don't attend the Algebra Workshop. He's always there to help.

Attend workshop. After every lecture. For 2 hours. And you'll do fine. You can't expect to cram Math, and then blame a bad grade on your prof. This course will be more about you, and your ability to be strict with yourself and focus, than his teaching style. He is incredibly helpful, responsive to feedback, and an overall nice guy. Do your part!

Honestly, the second worst prof I have ever had in my education career.  The problem is that he doesn't give live demos, all he does is talk and flick through power point slides at the speed of light.   Do yourself a favour and get a different prof, unless you are fine with teaching yourself the whole course from the textbook.
Just don't. Averages less than 40%. At least once a week the man gave up and said "I don't know how to do this" on his own examples.
He is nice but sometimes it is hard to understand him.

As a person, I like him. But, not as a prof. Constantly messing up explanations in class, makes things more confusing. Takes forever to post lecture slides, despite having weekly quizzes on the material in the lecture slides. And many slides still have mistakes in them. Don't take him if you're not confident in your ability to teach yourself math.
Have Prof Goddyn for 8:30am class 3 times a week. Should be living hell but he makes the class interesting. Clearly cares about students.
he was very lively but also a bit of a scatterbrain ... hard to follow
